page.title: 11Fox Ash Growers
page.content: Fox Ash Growers Packing Station begun in 1934 when it belonged to the government. The packing station is now owned by a co-operative of smallholders and employs 60 people. It owns 200 acres and grows some produce, but 40 other smallholders send their produce to the packing station as well. They pack lettuce, tomatoes, celery, marrows and peppers. The salad is graded, put in boxes or polythene and then put in a cold store to cool so that it will not go bad in the shops. It is transported in refrigerated lorries 40 ft long. Some produce goes to Covent Garden. Supermarkets they supply include M.& S B.H.S., Sainsbury, Asda, Argyl, Safeways, Littlewoods and International. They export celery to Europe. Turnover for the packing station is Â£l.5 million.
